title: 107_hr2732
content: The Act is titled the "Stop Westward Aquatic Threats Act" and includes amendments to the Nonindigenous Aquatic Nuisance Prevention and Control Act of 1990. It introduces the 100th Meridian and Westward Program under Subtitle C. The Secretary will work with States to educate the public on the threat of zebra mussels and other aquatic species, develop prevention action plans, and monitor the movement of these species across the 100th meridian to prevent their westward advance. The Secretary, in collaboration with the Secretary of Transportation and the States, will establish check stations on highways and waterways that cross the 100th meridian to check commercial vessels for zebra mussels and aquatic weeds. Contaminated vessels will be required to be cleaned at these check stations. The Task Force will develop protocols for cleaning vessels at check stations on highways and waterways crossing the 100th meridian. Violators will face a $150 civil penalty for multiple violations. Vessels stopping at check stations will be recorded, and prevention efforts will target states with the most contaminated vessels. Coordination with Canadian authorities is required. The Secretary of the Interior will coordinate efforts to prevent the spread of aquatic nuisance species by vessels and other potential vectors involved in the Lewis and Clark Bicentennial Expedition. The Secretary of the Interior will coordinate efforts to prevent the spread of aquatic nuisance species by vessels involved in the Lewis and Clark Bicentennial Expedition. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2002 through 2005. The evaluation of effectiveness will be conducted by an independent entity by January 1, 2005. If necessary, the Secretary may apply the section to states located west of the 100th meridian. The evaluation of the 100th meridian and westward program to stop the spread of aquatic nuisance species is to be completed by January 1, 2005. $5,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2003 to 2007 for this purpose. SEC. 4. STATE MANAGEMENT PLANS. Grants to States for development of management plans under Section 1204(b) are amended to include hiring personnel for plan development. Implementation of comprehensive management plans and public facility management plans with Federal assistance is emphasized. Authorization of appropriations under Section 1301 is also amended. The curr_chunk states that funding for capacity building by the Western Regional Panel is authorized for States located west of the 100th meridian. $600,000 is allocated for each fiscal year from 2003 to 2007.
